page.title: 20Whalley - a child's view
page.content:
{W Weddings}in the churches three, {H Homely}ties for the young and old. {A Abbey}ruins bring tourists from afar {L Learning}at the village schools {L Lazy}walks through Spring Wood. {E Everything}sold in the village shops {Y Yesterday}I went to school there. by Elizabeth Holmes (Age 11) {W What}a village, what a view, {H Have}a browse at the old and new. {A Abbey,}church and school are here, {L Lots}of pubs with frothy beer. {L Late}night shopping at the Spar {E Even}craft shops for visitors far. {Y You'll}enjoy it I must admit - I've lived here for quite a bit. by Joanna Haworth (Age 11)
{1985 Domesday Project-Whalley District -all material and research work carried out by{Whalley C.E.Primary {School-J4 class }June/July 1985
